details.title: Ground moving target indication for high-resolution wide-swath synthetic aperture radar systems

kwd: high-resolution wide-swath synthetic aperture radar systems

authors.affiliation: Key Lab. for Radar Signal Process., Xidian Univ., Xi'an, China
authors.name: Taoli Yang

authors.affiliation: Key Lab. for Radar Signal Process., Xidian Univ., Xi'an, China
authors.name: Zhenfang Li

authors.affiliation: Key Lab. for Radar Signal Process., Xidian Univ., Xi'an, China
authors.name: Zhiyong Suo

authors.affiliation: Key Lab. for Radar Signal Process., Xidian Univ., Xi'an, China
authors.name: Zheng Bao

details.abstract: In this study, a new approach is presented to detect ground moving targets and estimate their motion parameters for high-resolution and wide-swath (HRWS) synthetic aperture radar (SAR) systems. First, the space-time adaptive processing is adopted for clutter suppression, followed by the traditional SAR imaging and constant-false-alarm-rate detection for obtaining the ambiguous images of ground moving targets. Then, the real targets can be distinguished from all the ambiguous ones based on the space relationship between ambiguous images. Finally, according to the shift amount of moving targets in azimuth, which can be obtained by utilising the range histories of moving targets, the motion parameter can be achieved. The spaceborne HRWS simulation data confirm the validity of the method.

ieee.title: Robust Clutter Suppression and Moving Target Imaging Approach for Multichannel in Azimuth High-Resolution and Wide-Swath Synthetic Aperture Radar
ieee.displayText: Shuang-Xi Zhang, Meng-Dao Xing, Xiang-Gen Xia, Rui Guo, Yan-Yang Liu, Zheng Bao, "Robust Clutter Suppression and Moving Target Imaging Approach for Multichannel in Azimuth High-Resolution and Wide-Swath Synthetic Aperture Radar", Geoscience and Remote Sensing IEEE Transactions on, vol. 53, pp. 687-709, 2015, ISSN 0196-2892.

ieee.title: A novel algorithm to estimate moving target velocity for a spaceborne HRWS SAR/GMTI system
ieee.displayText: Taoli Yang, Yong Wang, "A novel algorithm to estimate moving target velocity for a spaceborne HRWS SAR/GMTI system", Geoscience and Remote Sensing Symposium (IGARSS) 2016 IEEE International, pp. 3242-3245, 2016, ISSN 2153-7003.

ieee.title: Simultaneous Stationary Scene Imaging and Ground Moving Target Indication for High-Resolution Wide-Swath SAR System
ieee.displayText: Xueshi Li, Mengdao Xing, Xiang-Gen Xia, Guang-Cai Sun, Yi Liang, Zheng Bao, "Simultaneous Stationary Scene Imaging and Ground Moving Target Indication for High-Resolution Wide-Swath SAR System", Geoscience and Remote Sensing IEEE Transactions on, vol. 54, pp. 4224-4239, 2016, ISSN 0196-2892.

ieee.title: Range and Doppler estimation of multiple moving targets for pulsed Doppler radars with CFAR detector at very low SNRs
ieee.displayText: Muhammad Zohaib Butt, Sufi Tabassum Gul, "Range and Doppler estimation of multiple moving targets for pulsed Doppler radars with CFAR detector at very low SNRs", Emerging Technologies (ICET) 2014 International Conference on, pp. 147-152, 2014.
